pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:0.5: 88. The training rule on upholstered with cotton down
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six got beds and benches made upholstered with cotton down.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.3: When people who were walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.4: “How can the Sakyan ascetics get beds and benches made upholstered with cotton down? They are just like householders who indulge in sensual pleasures.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.5: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.6: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.7: “How can the monks from the group of six get beds and benches made upholstered with cotton down?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.11: “… Foolish men, how can you get beds and benches made upholstered with cotton down?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.12: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.13: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:1.14: ‘If a monk gets a bed or a bench made upholstered with cotton down, it is to be stripped, and he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.6: there are four kinds of beds: one with legs and frame, called _masāraka_; one with legs and frame, called _bundikābaddha_; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.8: there are four kinds of benches: one with legs and frame, called _masāraka_; one with legs and frame, called _bundikābaddha_; one with crooked legs; one with detachable legs.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.10: there are three kinds of cotton down: cotton down from trees, cotton down from creepers, cotton down from grass.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.12: if he makes one or gets one made, then the effort constitutes wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.13: When he obtains it, it is to be stripped, and he is then to confess an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.14: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.15: If he gets others to finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.16: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.17: If he gets others to finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.18: If he makes one or gets one made for the benefit of someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.1.19: If he obtains one that was made by someone else and then uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.2: if it is for a back-and-knee strap;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.3: if it is for a belt;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.4: if it is for a shoulder strap;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.5: if it is for a bowl bag;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.6: if it is for a water filter;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.7: if he is making a pillow;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.8: if he obtains one made by another and he strips it before using it;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.10: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc88:2.2.11: The sixth rule, the training rule on upholstered with cotton down, is finished.
